# Additional readings

## Existing work on LGBTQ community

[These are key examples of work on LGBTQ community. I've worked backward from them to determine what concepts and readings I should include. They're the sources of key themes like place, cultural reproduction, and group membership.]

Brown-Saracino, Japonica. 2017. How Places Make Us: Novel LBQ Identities in Four Small Cities. 1 edition. Chicago ; London: University of Chicago Press.

Kelly, Brian C., Richard M. Carpiano, Adam Easterbrook, and Jeffrey T. Parsons. 2014. “Exploring the Gay Community Question: Neighborhood and Network Influences on the Experience of Community among Urban Gay Men.” The Sociological Quarterly 55(1):23–48.

Orne, Jason. 2017. Boystown: Sex and Community in Chicago. Chicago ; London: University of Chicago Press.

Pfeffer, Carla A. 2014. “‘I Don’t Like Passing as a Straight Woman’: Queer Negotiations of Identity and Social Group Membership.” American Journal of Sociology 120(1):1–44.
